item.value: The blue whale can produce the loudest sound of any living animal. The sound can be detected as far away as 530 miles.
Intel introduces the first microprocessor, the Intel 4004 on November 15, 1971.
Orville and Wilbur Wright achieved the first flight of an airplane.on the morning of December 17, 1903.
There are 9 planets that circle the sun. They are divided into two groups: the inner planets (Mercury, Venus,Earth, and Mars) and the outer planets (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, and Pluto).
The shortfin Mako shark is the fastest fish.
The city with the largest population is Shanghai in China. It has almost 14 million inhabitants.
The biggest planet in the Solar System is Jupiter. It is 317 times as heavy as the earth
The earliest dated printed book is the "Diamond Sutra", printed in China almost 3,000 thousand years ago.
Mount McKinley in Alaska in the highest mountain in America. It is 20,320 ft high.
The launch of the Russian Spiknit 1 spcecraft started the 'space race' between Russia and America. Explorer 1 was the first spacecraft launched by the United States on 31 January 1958.
The first 'talkie' movie was Al Jolson's The Jazz Singer released in 1927.
Electric eels can stun both predators and prey with electric shocks of around 500 volts.
The longest river is the Nile. It is 6,650 Km ( 4,132 miles ) long. It flows into the Mediterranean Sea.
The shortest person in the world is Khagendra Thapa Maga. He is 56 cm ( 22 in ) tall. The shortest woman was Pauline Muster. She was 58 cm ( 23 in ) tall.
The shortest woman was Pauline Muster. She was 58 cm ( 23 in ) tall.
The tallest building in America is the Willius Tower in Chicago.
The world's oldest person was Kama Chinen. She lived in Japan and died a week before her 115th birthday.
The world's oldest person was Kama Chinen. She lived in the Japanese island of Okinawa. She died a week before her 115th birthday. She was born on May 10, 1895.
If you travelled to the Moon in a plane it would take about 16 days. It takes 3 days in a spaceship to get there.
The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean in the world. It covers about 1/3 of its surface. It is 155.557 million sq km.
